articles.author: Tom Balmforth
articles.description: Ukraine marked 1,000 days on Tuesday since Russia's full-scale invasion, with weary troops battling on numerous fronts, Kyiv besieged by frequent drone and missile strikes, and officials preparing for Donald Trump to reclaim the White House in January.
articles.title: Ukraine, marking 1,000 days of Russian invasion, eyes end to war next year

articles.author: James Pomfret, Jessie Pang
articles.description: Hundreds queued on Tuesday outside a Hong Kong court ahead of the sentencing of 45 pro-democracy activists in a landmark national security trial that has damaged the city's once feisty pro-democracy movement and drawn international criticism.
articles.title: Hundreds queue for sentencing of 47 Hong Kong democrats

articles.author: Lisandra Paraguassu, Anthony Boadle
articles.description: Leaders of the Group of 20 major economies were set to meet on Monday in Brazil for their annual summit, bracing for a shift in the global order with the return to power of U.S. president-elect Donald Trump.
articles.title: G20 summit confronts a global order unsettled by Trump's return

articles.author: Riham Alkousaa, Ari Rabinovitch
articles.description: An Israeli airstrike killed five people in central Beirut on Monday, Lebanon's health ministry said, the second day in a row Israel has hit a target within the capital as it presses its campaign against Iran-backed armed group Hezbollah.
articles.title: Israeli strike in Beirut kills five as Lebanon, Hezbollah accept US ceasefire proposal

articles.author: Lucy Craymer, Lewis Jackson
articles.description: A nine-day march by Maori and their supporters across New Zealand has culminated in Wellington on Tuesday at a rally with thousands readying to protest against a bill that opponents say seek to dilute the rights of the Maori.
articles.title: Thousands protesting New Zealand's Indigenous bill set to march to parliament

articles.author: Patricia Zengerle
articles.description: The U.S. Senate could vote as soon as Wednesday on legislation that would block arms sales to Israel, backed by lawmakers who say Israel is obstructing aid shipments desperately needed by Palestinian civilians in Gaza.
articles.title: U.S. Senate to consider measures blocking some weapons sales to Israel

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Paraguayan President Santiago Pena was hospitalized on Monday while attending the G20 summit in Brazil's Rio de Janeiro, his office said, citing an "indisposition" being treated at the city's Samaritano hospital.
articles.title: Paraguay President Pena hospitalized in Brazil while attending G20

articles.author: Lidia Kelly
articles.description: The leader of the Moscow-backed breakaway Georgian region of Abkhazia resigned on Tuesday after a deal allowing for the expansion of Russian business in the republic led to mass protests and the opposition seizing government buildings.
articles.title: Leader of Russian-backed breakaway Georgian region of Abkhazia resigns

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Moldova's interior minister resigned on Monday as promised changes started to take hold in the ex-Soviet state after pro-European President Maia Sandu was elected to a second term by a smaller than expected margin.
articles.title: Moldovan interior minister quits in post-election changes

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Clashes have started in Georgia's capital of Tbilisi between police and protesters opposing the results of the country's recent parliamentary election, Russia's TASS state news agency reported on Tuesday.
articles.title: Police, protesters clash in Georgia's Tbilisi, Russia's TASS agency reports
